modules.description: This module defines a set of severity levels for logging, including trace, info, warning, and error. It provides functions to convert these levels to strings, uppercase strings, and associated colors. These operations support log message formatting and visual differentiation in output streams.

Represents and converts color values to string format. Provides the `color_to_string` function to transform a `color` value into its corresponding string representation. Useful for logging or displaying color-coded output in applications.

This module enhances CLI output with colored logging based on configurable severity levels and decorations. It processes string messages and location metadata, applying color codes derived from severity levels like trace, info, warning, and error. The module integrates color and severity definitions to format log messages with visual distinctions, such as rendering errors in red or warnings in yellow. Users can customize log appearance by combining severity-to-color mappings with string formatting functions for readable terminal output.
